error.signature: React Hook useEffect has a missing dependency: 'value'. Either include it or remove the dependency array.
error.regex: React Hook useEffect has a missing dependency

verdict.summary: ESLint exhaustive-deps rule warns about a variable used in useEffect but not in its dependency array.

dead_ends.why_fails: Suppresses a real bug warning; effect may use stale values

dead_ends.action: Passing an empty dependency array to only run once
dead_ends.why_fails: Effect will use stale closure values if it reads state or props

workarounds.action: Add the missing dependency to the array: useEffect(() => { ... }, [value])
workarounds.how: Ensures the effect re-runs when its dependencies change

workarounds.action: If you intentionally want to exclude it, use useRef to hold the value
workarounds.how: const valueRef = useRef(value); valueRef.current = value; â€” ref doesn't trigger re-runs

frequently_confused_with.distinction: 'React Hook useEffect has a missing dependency' indicates a missing dependency in useEffect, while 'Error' indicates hooks called inside a class component.
'React Hook useEffect has a missing dependency' indicates a missing dependency in useEffect, while 'Error' indicates rendering a plain object as a React child.
